cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 55 mi ENE of Guantanamo, Cuba and 20 mi NW of the eastern tip of Cuba

motion.direction: N (forecast to turn NNW then NW)

cyclone.trajectory: Moving north-northwest through the Bahamas then curving northwest, brushing the Florida east coast and continuing up the Southeast coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: along or just offshore the Florida east coast between West Palm Beach and the Flagler/Volusia county line (closest coastal encounter)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch north of Sebastian Inlet to the Flagler/Volusia county line (does not yet include Jacksonville)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Golden Beach FL northward to Sebastian Inlet FL; Lake Okeechobee
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida east coast, Georgia and the Carolinas within the 5-day cone
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm force winds (39–57 mph) likely, with a 22% chance of sustained 50-kt (58-mph) winds and a 6% chance of hurricane-force (64-kt) winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential 3–5 ft surge possible along the northeast Florida coast if the center tracks just offshore during high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–7 inches with isolated 10 inches possible as Matthew parallels the coast, producing flooding rains along the lower St. Johns River basin.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas, dangerous surf and rip currents; possible short-fused tornadoes in outer rain bands.
